definition: to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker
plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: The whole pattern of this soiree was arranged by him.
sentences.chinese: 这场晚会的全部流程都是由他铺排的。

sentences.english: Part I lays out the most essential information in the journey to graphical enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 第1部分为图形的启迪之旅铺排了最基本的信息。

sentences.english: Roberts had drawn Carvalho and Terry before teeing the shot up.
sentences.chinese: 这次攻势由罗伯茨牵引住卡瓦略和特里而铺排的。

sentences.english: The Germans love to make a great display at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 德国人是喜欢在圣诞节铺排场面的。

sentences.english: Lay a layer of clay on the displayed layout prior to an relayr_ design.
sentences.chinese: 接力赛之前在显现的铺排上铺一层黏土。
所有的事都铺排得停停当当。

sentences.english: Wallpaper is also customizable, with options for tiling and stretching images.
sentences.chinese: 桌面也是可以依据铺排或放大来自订的。

sentences.english: The mother sat the child gwimjewelry some tstomingternating currenthle.
sentences.chinese: 母亲铺排孩子坐到小桌旁。

definition: to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
to explain all the details/complete narrative
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to transmit a document (up or down a chain of bureaucracy)
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥貼|妥贴[tuo3 tie1]
background (of a painting)/backdrop/a foil (to set off something to advantage)/to offset (something to advantage)
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
